title: Trump unveils new class of battleships amid US-Venezuela tensions | ABC NEWS
description: Donald Trump has unveiled a new series of navy battleships, named after himself, as the US continues its military interceptions of Venezuelan oil tankers in the Caribbean Sea. The UN Security Council will meet to address the escalating regional tensions under the request of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. title: Dedicated Darwin decorators deck out homes with Christmas lights | ABC NEWS
description: It's that time of year again, when dozens of dedicated decorators across Darwin deck out their homes in wonderful displays of Christmas lights. And this year, they proved that not even a cyclone was going to stop them from putting on a show. Mitch Abram was there and has this story for ABC News Northern Territory. title: NSW protest laws to be challenged in court as bill clears lower house | ABC NEWS
description: NSW is on the verge of passing Australia's toughest gun laws in direct response to the Bondi Beach terror attack. The bill also gives police extraordinary powers to restrict protests, which activists have swiftly flagged they will challenge in court. title: 20 Biggest Stories of '25 - Part Three
description: One Australian champion announced her arrival, while another absolute superstar shocked us with an early retirement. A flawed genius shook up the NRL with a sustained display of brilliance, with a dash of insanity. While the one of the longest suffering fanbases in Aussie sport earned the ultimate redemption.    Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Matt Bevan on the players in Trump’s orbit | ABC News Daily podcast
description: The US President Donald Trump has surrounded himself with colourful and controversial characters.    From Steve Witkoff, who once bought Trump a sandwich and is now taking the lead on peace efforts in Gaza and Ukraine, to Howard Lutnick, the tariff tsar.   How did they secure their key roles and what effect are they having on the policies of the most powerful nation on Earth?   This week, Sam Hawley is joined by ABC presenters and journalists to discuss their best stories and interviews from 2025.   Today, Matt Bevan, host of the ABC's If You’re Listening podcast, on the cast of characters in Donald Trump’s orbit.

title: NSW Parliament tightens gun and protest laws after Bondi attack | ABC NEWS
description: The NSW parliament has passed a contentious bill imposing stricter gun and protest restrictions in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack. The Minns government’s amendments, which received support from the Liberals and opposition from the Nationals and the Shooters and Fishers party, are set to be rubber-stamped in the lower house.  The reforms will enable Australia’s strictest gun laws, a ban on terrorist symbols and greater police powers to restrict protests. title: What does the new drop of Epstein files reveal? | ABC NEWS
description: A newly released batch of documents from investigations into the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein has suggested more links to Donald Trump and former prince Andrew.  Both men deny knowledge of Epstein's crimes. The new files include a mix of tip-offs to the FBI, internal prison communications, tax returns and a fabricated video.  The Department of Justice says some of the documents contained ‘untrue and sensationalist’ claims against the US president.  The new release also includes alleged email correspondence between a person named 'A' from Balmoral and Epstein’s former partner Ghislaine Maxwell  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-12-24/latest-epstein-files-dump-reveals-emails-from-a-at-balmoral/106176014  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Meeting the person who saved my life | ABC News
description: Six years ago, when a Perth father-of-three was battling acute myeloid leukaemia, he needed a miracle – a bone marrow donor match that would allow him to live.   An American student came to his rescue and this Christmas they met for the first time.  Around 80% of Australia's stem cell transplants come from international donors, as the country has one of the lowest comparable donor pools in the world.
